Yes, it is truly impressive what the Inca civilization was able to accomplish without modern technology. Their knowledge of engineering and stonework was truly remarkable and their structures have stood the test of time.

The Inca people used their environment to their advantage and found innovative ways to create structures that were not only functional but also beautiful. They had a deep understanding of the stones and how they could be worked to fit together to create these impressive structures. This knowledge was passed down from generation to generation, and the expertise of the stonemasons who built the structures is still admired today.

In many ways, the Inca civilization's approach to construction and engineering was ahead of its time. They were able to create structures using sustainable practices, and the communal culture helped make this possible. The Inca people worked and lived with respect for their environment and each other, creating a sustainable and stable culture that lasted for hundreds of years.

Even today, the Inca civilization is an inspiration and a source of wonder for many people around the world, showing that even without modern technology, remarkable feats are possible with knowledge, skill, and cooperation.
